fact_check_explanation_title: Steve Barclay’s figure for new nurses’ pay includes extra earnings
fact_check_explanation_summary: The health secretary said that a new nurse will typically earn over £31,000 a year on current pay. This is an estimate that includes extra earnings such as overtime. Basic …
The company is not offering a free sausage roll and hot drink to anyone who likes a Facebook post.

fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 variants including Delta are real
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post claims that the Delta variant is fake.

fact_check_explanation_title: Copycat posts about ‘missing’ boy shared widely on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: Hundreds of people have shared a fake appeal for information about an apparently missing boy.

fact_check_explanation_title: Liz Kendall’s claim that there were no NHS strikes under Labour ignores local walkouts
fact_check_explanation_summary: Staff at NHS hospitals did take part in local strikes when Labour was last in power.

fact_check_explanation_title: How much of the rise in ‘economic inactivity’ is due to long Covid?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A BBC news bulletin claimed a recent rise in the number of people who are neither working nor looking for work is “largely because of long Covid”. But there are …

fact_check_explanation_title: Boy claimed ‘missing’ on Facebook was found months ago
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture is of a boy of a different name who went missing in June but has been found.

fact_check_explanation_title: Amazon is not selling Kindle Oasis e-readers for £1.78 for Black Friday
fact_check_explanation_summary: Amazon is holding a Black Friday sale, but it has confirmed it is not offering Kindle Oasis e-readers for £1.78, as a number of Facebook posts have claimed.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake Argos ‘deals’ on electric scooters and air fryers circulating online
fact_check_explanation_summary: Deals that appear too good to be true are circulating on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: Can you tell a drink has been spiked by its appearance?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A poster shares ways to tell if a drink has been tampered with. But spiked drinks do not necessarily exhibit any changes in appearance, taste or smell.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post misinterprets BBC report on a ‘spike’ in neonatal deaths
fact_check_explanation_summary: The BBC article said that “two spikes” in the neonatal death rate had occurred in Scotland—not that spike proteins had been found in babies’ bodies.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook posts claiming man with dementia is missing with his dog are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture in the posts shows a man with a different name who has never gone missing.
